ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Introduction and basic parts of Japanese language. Learn to greet, ask basic questions, and hold basic conversations.
After completing eteting this course I am able to read all of hirigana and katakana as well as 50 - 80 different kanji!!! Super interesting course and was my favorite class during the fall semester
This course is very thorough and you learn a lot of new vocab as well as sentence structures. I left with a solid understanding of basic Japanese, including reading writing and speaking.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: very engaging class. The sensei is very kind and understanding, and very patient!
Very beginner friendly, but a bit fast-pace(this is understandable as there is a lot to get done).

Strength: well-structured

Weakness: I think the pace of this course (6 lessons for 12 weeks; 2 weeks per lesson) is a bit too fast for those without previous exposure to Japanese (through manga, etc.). Everything feels a bit rushed, especially at the end of the semester. And it is like cramming instead of real studying. We don't have enough time to master the vocabulary and grammar for each lesson. At the end of the semester, I feel like I've already forgot most of the vocabulary learnt in Lessons 3 and 4. I'm not sure how it could be improved other than slowing down the pace (maybe 5 lessons for the semester instead of 6?).

Strengths --> homework was very easily accessible and you could submit it either online or in person
Weaknesses --> literally none I loved this class

Strengths: lots of topics covered, ensures you improve a lot in the language
Weaknesses: this learning takes place at a fast pace and is challenging

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, to those interested in learning languages. It is very rewarding and made a lot of friends along the way
If you're planning taking this course, I would highly recommend getting familiar with hiragana and katagana by yourself during the summer/before the semester begins.

YES!!!!!! I learned so much in this class that I never thought I could learn in such a short amount of time. This course really gets you to learn such advanced concepts thoroughly, but in such a short amount of time without feeling too stressed about it either. This was genuinely my favorite class during the fall semester and I was always excited to attend!!!

You have to be motivated because the workload is intense. The daily homework and meeting every day for class takes up a lot of time and personally I had to spend 1-2 hours per day of studying to keep up in the class. If you are very passionate about learning Japanese, I would recommend it.
